item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Dr. Perky:

This movie will be epic so glad its getting a nationwide release hopefully it come to a nearby theater if not I’ll have to wait till DVD

I almost forgot about this! And it’s been so long since they’ve done a regular video.

Grand_General_Hot:

2012 Proper Trailer…
Yep it, its another CGI Romp from Roland Emmerich…

There’s a giant flood that will wipe out the world, so people try to survive it by escaping in a giant boat. HOW ORIGINAL. :rolleyes:

item.title: Movie trailers thread - post videos and discuss upcoming movies
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Grand_General_Hot:

2012 Proper Trailer…

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x8DsedBMubw&feature=channel_page

Yep it, its another CGI Romp from Roland Emmerich…

Looks cool! And it’s directed by the guy that made “The Day After Tomorrow”, which was great! Unfortunatly, it’ll give the idiots that actually think this crap is real a reason to gloat, and maybe it will inspire more people to become idiots!

Anyway, I bring you the closest thing we’ll ever get to a Wolfenstein movie:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5sQhTVz5IjQ
Remember to watch this awesomeness in HD!

item.title: Movie trailers thread - post videos and discuss upcoming movies
item.dc:creator: InterloperX
item.description:
Sadly, I still have yet to see a Toy Story movie and I really should. One of my all time favourite movies (The Incredibles, ridiculously amazing movie) is a Pixar film, and the more I see them the more I’m immensely impressed by their clever presentation and narrative.

I do hope they come up with a sequel idea to the Incredibles someday, until then I’m going to make sure I check out the Toy Story flicks.

Rachel Nichols may look smokin’ hot as a red head, and Sienna Miller is always hot… But damn G.I. Joe is going to bomb and incredibly hard.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZBfnQXWvatw

io9.com has a beef with the new flick too. Video included.

https://io9.com/5273632/new-gi-joe-trailer-and-clip-show-just-how-embarrassing-those-power-suits-really-are

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Wasabi:

I think you’re getting lame confused with awesome there my good sir.

Hey, I never said they sucked. I like the way they music sounds (not so much the dude singing). But I think the band itself is pretty poopish and overrated.

item.source: Movie trailers thread - post videos and discuss upcoming movies

item.title: Movie trailers thread - post videos and discuss upcoming movies
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
InterloperX:

N’ah, while that was cool, it was a much more straight forward attempt to cut off the other biker (all in b-lines), none of this banging into each other and ability to have mild turning as opposed to the dead right angles.

It literally looked like they were paying homage to the speeder bike scene in that clip, shots and all.

Skip to 1:40

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qrrrmhUz2o4

Actually, you’re right, I hadn’t looked at the trailer in a while. It’s worth pointing out this was made as test footage when the film was in early development and long before actual production began, so there’s no telling how much it might be indicative of the finished film. Having said that, since the filming went ahead, the test footage was obviously deemed worthy.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
raw_bean:

Be prepared for the others to be less great: ‘Khan’ is the acknowledged pinnacle of the series. IV is pretty damn funny and good, but campy and dated.

Well, I’ll soon find out I guess. I got the trilogy collection so I can watch it right now!

Read full topic
item.source: Movie trailers thread - post videos and discuss upcoming movies

item.title: Movie trailers thread - post videos and discuss upcoming movies
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
John Killer118:

Maybe I should of used better wording.
I’m not completely Star Trek retarded.
What I meant by “Star Trek Trilogy” was what fans (and the DVD box set) perceive as a trilogy, which is II, III, and IV. I assumed this trilogy was a good place to start off with. Also, I know there was a TV show (who doesn’t?) And I know the new one’s a reboot, but like I did with “King Kong,” I want to see how it was before I see the new version.
Anyway, I finished watching “II: Wrath oh Khan.” It kicked ass! One of the best films I’ve ever seen!

Be prepared for the others to be less great: ‘Khan’ is the acknowledged pinnacle of the series. IV is pretty damn funny and good, but campy and dated.

Read full topic
